name: Premier Inn London Gatwick Airport (A23 Airport Way)

reviews.text: Location close to the north terminal. Not a great footpath to the airport, very narrow and slightly confusing. Dropped off my party at the hotel before parking at long stay car park. However the hotel is secured by parking barriers, could not get out before the ticket had been validated, took over 15 minutes.
reviews.title: Convenient airport hotel

reviews.text: Room good, no noise, usual premier inn standard.
reviews.title: Offers Gatwick passengers a comfortable, pleasant and convenient place to spend the night

reviews.text: Service in bar for food was very very slow, looked like there was insufficient staff. Food ok. Could not get a table in restaurant, I suspect most guests book prior to arrival.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bus to airport stops at south terminal first before going to the.north terminal. Cost is £3 per person and takes about 15 minutes to north terminal, the bus stop is also quite a walk to the terminal! Quicker to walk from hotel but not as easy as it appears!
reviews.title: Great Value airport hotel and parking at Gatwick

reviews.text: Overall good choice for airport stopover provided a good price is obtained.
reviews.title: Not good value

reviews.text: terrible attitude by receptionist guy wants to give you a lecture about booking and changing dates at 1am, then forgets to cancel original booking, leading you to be charged twice and then having to phone an 0871 number charging £1 a minute so £8 to get money back, it such a shame that one person makes the difference as its good value and normally very friendly
reviews.title: dont ask to change booking dates

reviews.text: Family room, good size. Comfy beds, clean and tidy. Restaurant food, ok. Staff very friendly. No noise from airport. Bus included in price to transport you over to terminal. Big plus is that your car stays where you park it, you. Do not have to leave your keys for them to move it whilst you are away. Very convenient for over night stay prior to early flights.
reviews.title: Very convenient!

reviews.text: Our flight was changed from midday to 6am so we booked an overnight stop with parking. Premier lived up to its name with supercomfortable bed and facilities and a wonderful receptionist who went out to find a parking space then directed my husband to the space addressing him by name. (He was waiting outside in the car while I checked us in)
reviews.title: Flight change lifesaver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bus intervals seemed further apart than published but maybe I was just impatient.
reviews.title: Gatwick North

reviews.text: Does what it says on the tin. Easy walk from Gatwick North even with suitcases.
reviews.title: Very close to airport and parking a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: as always Premier inn delivered , comfort and peaceful surroundings
reviews.title: a good airport stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel, & were made to feel special. Can't recomend this hotel enough and what makes it more appealing appart from the low cost is the close proximity (withing walking distance,(5min) ) of the North terminal.
reviews.title: Very warm welcome

reviews.text: We had an excellent meal in the internal restaurant on the night of our arrival, but because of our early flight departure could note take advantage of the breakfast facitities.
reviews.title: Everything NOT premier apart from the price!!

reviews.text: The location for this hotel is brilliant along With the modern bar/dining area, the food was also lovely however my purpose of this visit was to have a good nights sleep in the room. The room was dated including the bathroom. I have seen more modern furniture in my Nans house. This was a big let down as previous premier inns have had top class rooms. I have stayed in the travelodge at gatwick and the room is exactly the same for half the price!!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic option for night before stay

reviews.text: This hotel was brilliant for value for money, parking, food quality and closeness to Gatwick North Terminal. It is so close we walked to the terminal in the morning. Highly recommend for families with young children as the rooms had everything you need and the food was very good. Staff at reception were great but slightly less so in the restaurant but the food compensated!
reviews.title: A good overnight stay

reviews.text: The hotel was very busy on a Friday night, but reception dealt with 4 of us quickly and efficiently. It is worth booking at the restaurant as that was also busy and we had to wait. The room was comfortable and quiet and met our needs for a night. Meal at the restaurant was fine, though I was a bit put out that they had not updated their drink prices in the bar. We were up early the next morning and breakfast was available from 5.00am - we had the quick take it and go option. The North terminal is walkable, but not quite as close as they suggest. It also took a bit of finding from the terminal when we arrived. Good value though and cant complain.
reviews.title: Convenient overnight stop

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night after attending a garden party at a friend's house near Brighton. I chose it because it is within walking distance of North Terminal and I had an 8 am flight the next day back up home to Scotland. The room was a decent size and very clean. I had tea and coffee-making facilities. But, room-only, it cost £65 for one person and I consider this to be overpriced.
reviews.title: Large, clean rooms, good location, but overpriced

reviews.text: Currently at the Premier Inn at Gatwick Central. Rooms and location is excellent and reception staff are quick to deal with a steady flow of guests.
reviews.title: Great hotel, rubbish restaurant service.

reviews.text: The service at the restaurant was very disappointing. On arrival at our pre booked table we were met by complaints from customers on surrounding tables about the slowness of the service. We waited a significant amount of time before our order was even taken and then over 40mins before we saw our food. The food was of good quality, but would consider nipping to the local garage to get a snack if we stay here again.
reviews.title: Great way to start a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night as we had an early flight scheduled. We took advantage of the 'park and fly' deal and I must say it did make the whole start of the holiday much easier. We arrived the evening before our flight and checked our flight hold luggage into the airport then drove to the hotel and parked the car. Once we were there we had dinner in the restaurant. It was VERY busy so I would advise that you book ahead.
reviews.title: Perfect for the north terminal

aka: Premier Inn Gatwick Airport Central Hotel
